title: How to Use Oil in Your Breadmaker

steps.headline: Follow the recipe for the amount of oil and sugar used.
steps.description: Since oil inhibits the dough from rising and sugar the opposite, measure the amount of oil and sugar accurately.

steps.headline: Put oil first in the breadmaker pan.
steps.description: Slowly spin the pan to let the oil coat the bottom and sides of the pan so the flour will not stick to them.

steps.headline: Redo your ingredients list and put oil at the top of the list.
If you put in the flour before the oil, dribble the oil on the sides of the pan and spin the pan to coat it.
steps.description: Ideally, put the oil in first.

text: Follow the recipe for the amount of oil and sugar used. Since oil inhibits the dough from rising and sugar the opposite, measure the amount of oil and sugar accurately. Put oil first in the breadmaker pan. Slowly spin the pan to let the oil coat the bottom and sides of the pan so the flour will not stick to them. Redo your ingredients list and put oil at the top of the list.  If you put in the flour before the oil, dribble the oil on the sides of the pan and spin the pan to coat it. Ideally, put the oil in first.
